On the opening formed by pages 234 and 235 of the 1783 catalog, for instance, a series of Jefferson occasionally marked the point at which a book was to be inserted by indexing titles on the facing recto with a siglum, usually letter, and adding a labelled arrow at the appropriate point on the verso (see, for example, pages 104 and 105 of the 1783 catalog).
